availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Rogers (Estill County, Kentucky, resident and soldier in the 47th Mounted infantry (U.S.A))

body.p: Estill County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Rogers and Mary Rogers. Resident in Estill County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident in Estill County in 1860. Served in Company I of the 47th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) from March 23, 1864 to June 15, 1864. Discharged for being convicted of manslaughter and sentenced to 10 years confinement in the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 54A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 269.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Millers Creek, p. 575B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0443.
